text: Custom House Block, 2011 The Custom House Block, built in 1845-87 in Boston, Massachusetts, is a former warehouse located on Long Wharf, at the end of State Street. Architect Isaiah Rogers designed the four-story building, constructed of granite and brick. In its 19th-century heyday, it contributed to the life of "Boston's busiest pier, commercial port, and embarkation point for travelers." Today private owners maintain the site.Boston Directory. 1848Southworth, Susan & Southworth, Michael (2008) AIA Guide to Boston (3rd ed.) p.74 The building was renovated in 1973 by Anderson, Notter, Feingold. ==See also== * Custom House District * Long Wharf (Boston) * Boston Custom House ==References== ==External links== * Category:National Historic Landmarks in Boston Category:Buildings and structures in Boston Category:Landmarks in Financial District, Boston Category:Wharves of Boston Category:Redeveloped ports and waterfronts in the United States Category:Industrial buildings and structures on the National Register of Historic Places in Massachusetts Category:Commercial buildings completed in 1848 Category:History of Boston Category:Warehouses in the United States Category:National Register of Historic Places in Boston
title: Custom House Block (Boston)
